Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: jatinobhan
Reviews.Content: the hotel is made only for chinese people.... i stayed there for 4 days the rooms are small and the bread for all 4 days at the breakfast table was stale and even had fungus on it... except for reception each and every staff is chinese and cannot understand english... on the breakfast i asked the staff for a boiled egg dhey refused to me saying they dont have it and 10 min later a chinese man was served the same.... on complaining to the manager he said we have good chinese customers and we serve them well... the air conditioner was not working in my room and when i requested to change the room or to get the air con fixed they denied it saying the hotel was full... on chatting with the cleaning staff later we were informed the occupancy is less than 60%... if ur chinese this is the place to be if ur not chinese dont even stay there for free...

Reviews.Title: “get best of the midesty, about a 15 minutes walk to the popular sights”
Reviews.Author: Malwina5
Reviews.Content: Quick Accommodation process, polite & ready to help staff. We got a room for two, warm & cozy, a bathroom was exceptionally clean. If you like music chanels better take your iphone or whatever. The location is perfect - that is, you can easily get to all means of city transportation , walk to the popular sights, grab a snack in the midnight & buy souvenirs. Room service is very pertinent. Breakfast menu is one of a good selection, though vegetables are unfairly missed & coffee is much better outside. Check in/ out were effective. Free wifi. Computer downstairs. I grade it maximally for the 4* level

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaneko1
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed here for 4 days was a very nice hotel with a comfortable room and a good breakfast buffet. It was perhaps further away from the centre of Rome than we thought but transport was easy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Stay over easter holiday April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Costas A
Reviews.Content: Very good 4 star hotel. 5 minute walk from main Termini station. Kept in very good condition and all facilities in room working inclusive of safe in wardrobe. Hot water all the time and shower in good working condition. The reception staff were all english speaking and helpful whilst all other staff were only too pleased to help if needed. Continental style buffet breakfast served between 7am-10am. The room size was good with a small TV screen but no tea making facilities in room. At checkout you will be asked to pay 18 Euros for each room representing a city tax. I understand all hotels ask for this and it is raised on notice boards near reception. The location of the hotel was good with easy access to all forms of public transport. Public transport 1Euro for a single journey up to 75 mins on all buses / trams / trains. 4 Euros for a daily ticket. Great value for money. Open bus tours from 23 Euros covering all sites.

Reviews.Title: “really three and a half”
Reviews.Author: aliciamary
Reviews.Content: mixed, very good and not so good location perfect close enough to get buses from termini and lots of places to eat but just off the main drag reception very good bedroom mixed, hard beds, was told new matresses and we did sleep well once we got used to them shortage of drawers and better lighting would help in the bedroom lovely walk in shower and fluffy towels endless hot water any time it seemed well lit bathroom crowed dining rooms depending on the time well stocked up constantly but no fresh fruit but yes I would go back there we had a very good price booked in advance with booking . com

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SarahKate88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 3 nights here in January. The hotel was clean and the staff were very helpful in offering us advice and assistance. There was a nice daily breakfast and a location that meant you were quite central to all the key locations in Rome. We really enjoyed the 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, as it allowed you to see other parts of the city. I would stay here again, but I would go further afield next time to find better and more 'authentic' and less touristy Italian restaurants. We were somewhat disappointed with the restaurants nearby the hotel. Overall a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Paula0000
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at Augusta Lucilla Palace. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is good - a ten minute walk from Termini station, and five mins from Republica metro. It has been said that the Termini area can be rough, but we found it fine. There is a good cafe nearby. The breakfast at the hotel is comprehensive, but the breakfast room can be a bit like Picadilly Circus in rush hour at times. Our room was lovely, extremely spacious and very comfortable and clean. The staff were always very helpful and polite. There is also free wifi. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Olivia K
Reviews.Content: Recently my family and I stayed at the Agusta Lucilla Palace Hotel during a Make-A-Wish Trip to Rome, Italy. We immediately bonded with the delightful staff, especially at the concierge desk. The hotel was beautiful with very comfortable beds, and a wide variety of choies for their continental breakfast and excellent service. Andrea, Gianluca, Erik, Tiziano, and Georges. We made fast friendships with Adrea and the other staff and they were extremely helpful with calling taxis, giving us direction, telling us the best sites, and catering to every annoying need we had. They even accommodated us when we had a friend come to visit us while we were there and gave her a great room at last minute notice. We loved staying here, except, there was no wifi unless you wanted to pay a very high price for it. Lastly the thermostat was unable to cool the room at a reasonable temperature and this required us needing to open all the windows and utilize fans during the night. However, I highly recommend this hotel for it kind and helpful staff and nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: grantem2000
Reviews.Content: I like the location close to Termini just off Via Cavour and we got a great price booking in advance with Travel Republic (£131 B&B for 2 people sharing a double room for 2 nights), so above average for the price and location. Room was clean but small (no problem for our 2 night stay but watch out if you plan a longer stay) and there were some irritations. Lights in our bedroom were either all on or all off - no way to have bedside light alone switched on. Sticky cistern had been leaking long enough to stain the china and was quite noisy till we worked out how to make it release fully (gentle wiggle of the "push to flush" panel) and stop constant dribble of water into the wc. TV very small so hard to see from bed even in a small room, and there were very few channels, but nice to have it and we did get to watch the Australian Grand Prix coverage on Italian TV. Service was courteous at all times (but maid woke us at 8am on our last morning - best remember to put out the "do not disturb sign" - we didn't!). Wifi coverage seemed quite good but was chargeable (fair enough given the room rate). Breakfast was fine and a nice bonus to have it included at this price. I'd happily go back to this hotel if we got another good deal on price, but I will look around and may choose another in the same area next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Gezelek
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel in may 2011 for 3 days while we were travelling italy from Capri to Milan. The Rooms are clean and adequate size. The hotel is very close to train station and it was very easy to get wherever we want with subway. What is really great about the hotel was the service. The Staff really helped us to get the online tickets for Vatican Museum and really tried to do whatever they can for our inquiries. Also the breakfast which was included in our price was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,rooms and breakfast but poor service”
Reviews.Author: MilanSaxena
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel is situated in the city center, only a 5 minute walk from Bus & Train/Subway Station. If you are coming through flight, Terravision as well as other buses run every half an hour or so for all the airports from the station. Rome is a beautiful city which is also very rich in historical monuments and attractions and almost every tourist attraction is at walkable distance from this hotel. We stayed there for 5 days and took Subway (Metro) just once while going to Vatican City, rest of the places like Colossium, Roman Forum, Trevi, Pentheon etc can be reached by walking. The locality was very safe even at late night. We returned at 1am on two nights still felt very safe. Hotel: Room was of just sufficient size, and clean. There was a wardrobe with electronic safe. Bathroom was also average sized with basic toiletries. The staff knew good english. Hotel's breakfast selection was one of the best and most vast I have ever seen. Cereals, toast, fruits, beverages, meat.. everything was there. Air-Conditioning was perfect - although we visited Rome in the scorching heat of August, still the AC was sufficient to cool it down to a temp where you would feel the need of douvet. Internet was very expensive (£4/hour) so we didnt use that. But still I will rate the service as "poor" because we had a broken shower that would throw water in every direction while in use and would wet everyhing like floor, mirrors, clothes, toiletries, etc. We complained about it the very first morning, but it didnt get repaired for the next 4 DAYS!! Although they did something to reduced the breakage, but still it would squirt water in all directions and spoil the whole bathroom floor. That problem kind of kept ruining our experience for 5 days. Nearby: Because it is so close to City Center, there are lots of restaurants just 2 minute away from the Hotel (especially infront of the Train Station) and they serve delicious, fresh, authentic Italian food at reasonable prices. Other services/shops close to the Hotel are: Bicycle, Scooter rentals, shops selling tourist guides/tickets, internet cafes, flea market etc. Conclusion: Excellent location, average sized rooms & bathroom, amazing breakfast and in case you don't face any problem like the one I have mentioned above, you will enjoy the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Stephenfamilyofsix
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay in Augusta Lucilla for two nights at the end of our Italy trip. We chose the hotel as some friends were also staying there. Upon arrival at the front desk our reservation was for the following evening and night after, not for our first night. To make matters worse there were no rooms available to accommodate six of us. After some discussion and review, it became very obvious that I had made a mistake with the dates. Promptly the desk staff jumped into action and contacted nearby hotels and negotiated two rooms for us to stay in at the same rate. The porter also helped us move our luggage to a hotel 100 metres down the road. As our friends were staying there, we were also invited to have breakfast with them in the hotel despite now staying elsewhere. Unlike some of the recent reviews regarding poor service our first experience was excellent, in fact above the call of duty. Anyway we finally got to stay in the hotel for our second night. The triple rooms were small for three people. Our room was facing an internal stairwell. Not a good view but was much quieter then the rooms we had the kids in, as it was facing the street. There was an issue with the hot water in both rooms however it was resolved after an hour or so. Our flight was not until early evening so we asked for late check out (6PM) and for 40 Euro’s extra, one room was made available. There was also no request made to pay for the second night despite my booking error. The hotel is in a very convenient area. Close to the Termini and plenty of restaurants nearby. Not as luxurious as the other three hotels we stayed in Rome. The value for money was good and we found the service to be great especially in resolving my issue. A big thank you to the desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane P
Reviews.Content: My family and I had 48 hours in Rome recently at the end of our trip to Sicily. We wanted a hotel that was near everything. My son is 14 years old and quite tall, so we needed a room with space enough for the 3 of us, too. We found both here. The location of the hotel is fantastic for sightseeing and access to the main rail station and metro. There were plenty of nice restaurant choices with a few blocks. Reading other reviews, it sounds like some of the hotel's rooms are quite small, but ours was huge. Very clean and well appointed; very nice bathroom. Bedding is quite nice. We found the front desk staff to be very helpful and friendly. I don't stay at hotels for their breakfast; we prefer to eat locally. But we did have breakfast there one morning and it was more than adequate. WiFi is not free, but a 2 hour prepaid card was 5 euro; not that bad if you have to 'connect'. Again, I don't choose my hotel based on their WiFi. I guess different people expect different things from a hotel. For my family, this place was perfect. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: AanjhanR
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4-person room. It was sufficiently big with 1 double bed and 2 extra beds. The restrooms were pretty clean. WiFi is not free. The breakfast was jsut about sufficient. Staff at the reception speak decent English. The location is great. Its at a 5 min walkable distance from the Rome's main train station. They provide airport taxi service for a flat rate.

Reviews.Title: “Roma, Agusta Lucille experience”
Reviews.Author: Armando N Posted by a Best Day traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Augusta Lucilla for three nights, at the end of november, the place has a good location close to the train station, a few blocks from there, it´s very clean, there´s people around anytime and small convinience stores and but the furniture is a kind of old, the mattress are old, very uncomfortable and very used, hot water is not available all the time, the buffett isn't good (poor), also tv guide channels. If you look better you can find a better place for the same money. It´s a 3 stars, not a 4 stars quality. This is my personal opinion about it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel at a Reasonable price fairly well located.”
Reviews.Author: Alistair M
Reviews.Content: I had a double room which was small and which would have been cramped with two but that is fairly typical for large European cities unless you are paying premium rates. The pictures on the website are slightly misleading as the room appeared larger than it was but otherwise it was fairly modern room, clean with a comfortable bed and generally I have no complaints other than the walls were pretty thin and my neighbours doors shut with such a bang it would wake me up. The hotel is situated a short walk from Rome's main train station and 10 minute's walk from the Coliseum so ideal as a sightseeing base. Breakfast was pretty good as it included a small selection of hot food and together with the cold cuts will set you up for the day. All in all a good base in a fairly good location with reasonable staff at an affordable price, if you're looking for a comfortable place to stay as a base in Rome this should do but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Hotel, Great Location, below average service”
Reviews.Author: jcfbumpkin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights before a cruise in November. Tiny rooms even by European standards but very clean. Extremely poor lighting in rooms and bathrooms even with good vision. Excellent location . Its close to everything. Front desk staff were close to rude. They just dont want to be bothered. Breakfast was good. If I stayed here again it would be for the location. Also I would bring a portable light. LCD lighting for shaving just doesnt cut it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, and great great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several hotels in Rome and this is the best one by far. The location is perfect for us, close to the train station, the bus station, the metro and trams, but it is in a quiet side street. The staff were friendly and very helpful, the room was large and well equipped, and breakfast was very good. It is extremely good value for money and we have already booked for our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: trippyjoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights in mid october this year. the staff was very friendly answered any question asked. We had heard that George was very helpful and found that he and "his friend" at the desk provided great information. the room was very clean and large by european standards, breakfast was more than adequate with both hot and cold items that were fresh. For those who want fresh OJ or cooked to order, eat out. if you wait until the end of the serving time to eat you may find the eggs over cooked - your fault not theirs. also consider that most of the staff speak 3 or more languages, so don't complain when you can only speak one. the hotel was easy to find and close to the train terminal. we walked to most all areas in rome and found them within easy reach for us, we are age 70. The HOHO bus was great for most other areas like the vatican. i would stay there again and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to end a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hoaktran
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel. It was the best hotel that we stayed at on our trip in Italy. The staff are very nice and helpful. They speak English very well for foreigners who do not speak Italian. The location was excellent. It was right next to a major water taxi stop. It is between the train station and St Mark's Square so it was nice and quiet but convenient with the water bus stop. The room was very bright with large windows. The restroom is all marble with modern fixtures. the room was big enough for 2 people to be comfortable. We had 2 medium size luggages and the fit just fine. The breakfast was decent with the usual eggs and sausages. My wife loved the cappuccino that the waitress will make for you as you order. Definitely a good hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Nics-171
Reviews.Content: we found the staff to be very polite and helpful, the room was clean but small, good location we managed to mostly walk or use the underground to see the sites, breakfast was good but not many cooked options.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well located”
Reviews.Author: Sarsy47
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 4 girlfriends and booked as a flight/hotel package. I wondered whether it looked a bit far out of the centre on the map but in fact it didn't feel as though it was at all. Its also very convenient for the station/underground. There are also some good restaurants and bars around the area if you don't want to go back into the city centre in the evening. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean but quite small, however this didn't matter to us. the staff on reception were really helpful and speak good English and although the bar area isn't particulary nice to sit in due to the seating arrangement, when we did spend time there the barman gave great service and was lovely, going to a great deal of effort to get us some fab nibbles. Breakfast wasn't great but it was fine for a weekend, I would recommend this hotel for a long weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convinient location”
Reviews.Author: Paola-X
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Very centrally located. We walked almost everywhere, but you have the subway and bus/ train station some steps away. It's a nice hotel with good room quality. Clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices. Staff is mediocre. Some are nice and some are typically rude. Got a lot of help from the bartender on where to go and tips in general. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was not where we'd booked (our reservation was moved here when the hotel genova was over-booked), I was not unhappy. The hotel does not have a large frontage, but once inside, the reception is clean and cool; the staff were friendly and patient. They were happy to offer a range of local suggestions of places to eat/drink, and to help with making reservations. The room was not huge, but clean and fresh. The window opened onto a relatively quiet street. There was air conditioning but although the temperature outside was around 30 degrees, the room stayed fairly cool without turning the a/c on. The bathroom was a little dated, but clean and fully functioning. The room was cleaned thoroughly each day. The breakfast was plentiful and included cereals, stewed fruit and yoghurt, cheese and cooked meats, eggs, and pastries. It was a very short walk to piazza termini, and from there to either walk across the city or catch a bus. The hotel made an excellent base for exploring, and was particularly well-located for walking around the colosseum and pantheon in the late evening. I would use this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: yboua
Reviews.Content: the room was very small (large double bed + single) actually it was a double room with extra bed for a child. very clean hotel, except that the sheets were not changed during our stay 4 nights. very quiet also. Be carefull wireless internet connexion did not work in our room. breakfast quite good, but avoid fruit juice and fruit! very good location,close to the station (train, subway, tramway..) and most of the sites can be done by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Typical mediam large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maganista
Reviews.Content: Moderate sized very clean room, large enough modern bathroom with tub and shower, rather hard mattresses, AC barely worked - you were not allowed to adjust it and it was barely cool enough for my taste in the middle of September. The breakfast was very adequate - dont understand what everyone is fussing about - they had a large buffet with scrambled or hard boiled eggs and bacon and ham, several kinds of coffee cake, a few cereals, cold cuts, bread, canned prunes and peaches. The coffee was poor, the only place in Italy, the orange juice was from concentrate. You could load up for the day. The location worked great if you wanted to be close to the train station, providing easy bus connections. After a week of exploring Rome we found that you could walk almost anywhere in the central area if you took your time. (I had foot surgery in May and worried about this, but I had no problem.) Two elevators worked well to get us to the sixty floor.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star by international standards. More like a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: Iiievolution
Reviews.Content: Although there is nothing wrong with it, it's not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Could be a little bit cleaner. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: maclil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here prior to a cruise. The people at the front desk were efficient and helpful. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Breakfast was very good and offered a good variety. Location 5 minutes from Termini was handy to get around by Metro.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: yvonne k
Reviews.Content: Location is a bit sceary at night (spetialy for girls/whemen traveling alone). Its also far from touristic sites. The room wasn't clean enough when we got it. The lobby and dining room are depressing and breakfast is poor. Certainly not a 4 stars hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: I had a standard room. It was very small by north american standards, but it was well decorated and clean. So I really do not have any complaints. The bathroom looked newly renovated and had a modern decor. There was a large assortment of toiletries, including a shaving kit. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was quiet. The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. The breakfast included a very large assortment from sweet breads, to eggs, cereal and bacon (not the crispy variety, but nice nonetheless. Close to subway and train station.. walking distance (20 mins) to major sites. I would recommend this hotel. Cons: no bathrobes, kettle or coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.... and.... great hospitality!!!”
Reviews.Author: katly m
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in this hotel, from 22 - 25/10 . The hospitality was well !!!! The food was really good,.!!!!The staff are sooooo sooooo soooo friendly will do anything for you. Location of the hotel was perfect near the Termini train station........Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gus003_10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Spend six day end of July 2011. Stones throw from Termini (lots of shopping and grocery). Same distance from Piazza del Repbulica and buses. Walk to the Colessum and many resturants and shops very close. Staff great, although they should have free wifi. Breakfast great and very modern and clean. Not sure if noisy, wasn't for us. Floors were tile so if busy may be loud. I suspect that anyone that is not considerate it may annoy others.

Reviews.Title: “Classical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nbd028
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and comfortable - had a decadent air about it. It is very centrally located - very close to the bus and the train station. Breakfast was good the first day as there seemed to be quite a variety of food. However, on subsequent days we noticed that the bread and pastry was not as fresh and that it was probably brought forward from the previous day. However, the food is abundant ranging from cold hams to sweet pastry and brioche. The brioche were always fresh and delicious. The room was classical looking - maroon drapes and had a luxurious look. The bathroom was also comfortable although the heater in the bathroom switches on automatically in the morning and it took some time to heat up - we are early risers so we would have appreciated a heated bathroom earlier. At the end of our stay we were charged extra as Tax because the law had just come out that tourists are to pay around Euros 3 per night and I think per person (not sure about the amount though). All in all it was an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - perfect location - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: NartoursDk
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, near the train station ( 5 min. walk ). Bars and pizzerias nearby (Tourist menu with pizza, beer and icevream = 10 Euro). Good breakfast buffet with hot food (eggs,bacon.....) Bad price on internet - 5 Euro for 1 hour. The staff took away our bottle of water from the room (so we had to buy a new from the minibar)???

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, would not return here”
Reviews.Author: DrRico
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within a 2-minute walk from the train station. This is both a plus and a minus. What we did not like about the location was that it felt on the "wrong side of the tracks" at night and we felt a bit unsafe. The front of the hotel was lit up some nights and not lit up on other nights. So this added to the lack of safety. On the plus side, it was located at a 15-30 minute walk to all the tourist locations in Rome. I payed close to $275/night and got a Journey's End-level hotel room. There were 3 of us in the room, with my daughter sleeping on the pull out couch. When this couch was open, one could barely walk about the room. The lobby and entrance of the building was consistent with a 2 star hotel. Breakfast was typical hotel fare one finds in Italy, average at best. The scrambled eggs were horrible, but the cold cuts, canned fruit and toast were fine. I really appreciated one waitress who made me two cappucinos every morning. Thanks again! What disappointed me the most was the poor service at this hotel. When I spend $275/night, I expect good service. On the first day, I went to speak to the hotel clerk, he continued reading his paper for 45 seconds before raising his eyes and giving me a look to say that I was bothering him. On a second occasion, I asked for a second card key for the room. The clerk sighed and complained that everybody was asking for a second key today. If I returned to Rome, I would try to stay away from the train station and closer to the Piazza Navone or near the Borghese park.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and central”
Reviews.Author: Nick-Maria-Manolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights, from 15 to 19 of August 2011. The hotel is great, centrally located (just 5 min. by foot from Terminy bus, train and metro station). Very nice and clean rooms with good soudproofing... but a little small. Very nice bathrooms... The AC works fine (very important for the period we stayed there). The breakfast was perfect and plenty. No complains at all.. Me and my wife recommend this hotel to anyone is thinking of visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mipesq
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one evening but I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. Its 2 blocks from the train station, close to Piazza Della Republica and Via Nazionale. We received an upgraded room, which was a pleasant surprise. The room was large, with a two sink bathroom, that also included a tub! The bed was confortable and you could adjust the airconditioner to your liking. The only downside is that you have to pay for WiFi in your room. It was 5 euro's for one hour. They have breakfast as well and even offered to pack a breakfast for us since we would not make breakfast due to our early departure but I turned it down (i regret that now). Overall I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!! We will stay here again because of the location, staff and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place,great location”
Reviews.Author: richstowe
Reviews.Content: This is a very good 3 star hotel. We were able to walk to the hotel from the main Termini (Central Train station) with our luggage and we were able to walk to the Colliseum and Trevi Fountain. We arrived at 11 a.m. and our room wasn't ready. They stored our luggage and confirmed our reservation information.Our room was ready as promised by 1 PM. The room was small, especially by North American Standards but was clean and comfortable and had been updated. There were two elevators. Most importantly, the air condidioning was great as it was close to 100 degrees for the time we were there. The included breakfast was very good. There was a large selection of food and lots of tables. The only issues were that they only gave us one room key. When you were in the room you needed the key to activate the lights. If one of us wanted to leave they couldn't take the room key. The internet access was not included and was more expensive than we thought it should be (10 Euros/hour). There were several internet cafes nearby that were much cheaper which we used(1 euro for 1/2 hour). The staff was helpful and very polite. We booked through Air Canada vacations and our rate was less than the quoted rate at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JCOKUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply perfect! We walked to many places the first day and it was fine, if you don't mind walking. Everything in Rome seems faily close regardless. Yet, since it was just a few blocks from the main terminal, we purchased a 3 day transportation pass and enjoyed using the Buses and Subway. You will need to figure out how it works, but for anyone familiar with public transportation, it isn't that big of a deal The hotel room was nice and clean, a bit small compared to most US rooms, but its Europe...it was perfect! Nice bed, nice bathroom, room safe, nice closet, etc. It was very quite, I never noticed any noise of any kind. A couple nights there seemed to be a large tour bus/group there, but you would have never know. The buffet was good and offered a nice selection. No waffles or pancakes, but pleanty of Yogart, eggs, ham/bacon, ceral, juices, toast, etc. If you can't get enough here, or you don't like it, I would suggest the problem isn't with the hotel. We had an inside room, with not much of a view, but it didn't matter...we were in Rome and we were gone from after breakfast until it was time to go to bed. The staff was awesome, even those with their broken english. Extremely nice and accommadating. At one point, I needed Internet access in the evening but didn't have the appropriate Euro Change. The Clerk said, "Here you go, just pay me tomorrow". They were all so cool. It was nice having the hotel recommend /provide transportation from the airport. I think we had to pay extra for this, but it was very convenient since this was the first time in Rome. When I left, I walked with my bags to the train station and took the train to the port city to board a RC Cruise Ship. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “great first european hotel”
Reviews.Author: christinamoon
Reviews.Content: We were getting married in just a few short days and running between the Embassy, Preffetura, food, and touristy spots. The hotel concierges were beyond helpful with faxing, spoke english well and over all very kind. Bonus: a bar is just around the corner, great dinner spot down the street from there, coffee shop out the front and to the right and across from there- the train station. Great experience and would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: claw60
Reviews.Content: Good central location for sightseeing in Rome. The front desk staff were very helpful. The hotel had an Asian influence to it. The restaurant staff were all Asian and couldn't speak either English or Italian. The breakfast was not good. Stale baked goods and the coffee was cold every morning. Except for the location and the local front desk staff, we wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: oniesol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Augusta Lucilla Palace for 5 nights in early June. The location is very convenient – close to Termini Station, good (safe) neighbourhood with cafes, restaurants, Laundromat etc. Within a short walking distance are Maria Magiorre, Republicca, 15 minutes to Trevi and about 30 minutes to the Colosseum. The front desk staff we dealt with are all pleasant, accommodating and courteous. As we were travelling with our 8 yr old son, we were given a good size room with a sofa bed (already converted to a bed). I’d say overall the hotel is clean. My only complaint is the bathroom. The shower doors do not shut properly which made it difficult to bathe without getting the floors outside the shower area all wet. And there is also a very faint smell of urine in the bathroom – when we first arrived and in the succeeding days. (We just kept the door shut at all times!) The breakfast buffet is a pretty good deal. There’s a wide variety to choose from. We husband liked that there’s hot food such as scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages aside from the usual bread, butter and cheese and cereals. If they want to improve on the breakfast, it would be nice if they serve fresh fruits instead of canned / preserved fruits. Overall, I’d say overall it’s ok.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Nezzy17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. The people at reception was fine. Some don't understand English to well but they help out. There is a real nice place to eat. Turn left wen you come out the hotel there food is soo nice. Yea the rooms ate small but it didn't matter If your going Rome your not gonna spend much time in the room, there is too much to see. Plus I noticed most places are quite small in Rome. Location is fab. Close to everything. My boyfriend and I took the green line tour bus just to get around faster as we was only there for 4 day. Have nothing to complain about. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little more to find something nicer.”
Reviews.Author: TMazz1
Reviews.Content: Extremely small room. You get what you pay for with the free breakfast. Only redeeming quality is that it's walking distance to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gennarose
Reviews.Content: The Augusta Lucilla Palace Hotel is beautiful, clean and friendly. It's located just a few blocks' walk from Termini, the main train station in Rome, so it's super simple to get to just about anywhere by bus, train or Metro. It's around a fifteen-twenty minute gorgeous, scenic walk to many of the most famous sites such as the Trevi Fountain and the Piazza Navona. The Santa Maria Maggiore church (one of the most beautiful in Rome) is only two minutes away. I was traveling alone and so was concerned with safety, but it's in a well-lit, very safe area and they actually upgraded my twin bed room to a queen and let me check in an hour early. I arrived at 9am and couldn't check in until 1, but they held my luggage for me so I could "rome" around. They provide breakfast with your stay from 7am-10am--they have traditional Italian pastry, yogurt, cereal, eggs, bacon, bread and canned fruits. A very decent spread to fuel you for the endless walking you're bound to do during the day. They also have a bar that is open all day and a lot of the night--they serve little stuzzichini (snacks) with your beverages. Very accommodating, very helpful staff. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Claudino22
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel in my last vacation and the experience was terrible. We bought a standard room and it's impossible to turn around. The services are very poor, the breakfast is weak and the hospitality is horrible. I'll never come back and do not recommend this hotel. Forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Great Staff = Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: 3redstars
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great staff and is in a great location, situated only 3 blocks from the Termini Station. This was our first time in Rome, and felt we made a good decision staying here. We came in quite early, but were able to get our room an hour earlier from the normal 2pm check-in. The room was modestly small, but very clean with modern amenities. We had air conditioning which we took great advantage of during our 3 night stay. They had a flat screen tv, which had the bare minimum of channels but they had BBC and CNN so we were able to track the Icelandic Ash Cloud while were there. Wifi internet costs 5 euro an hour, which you had to get a prepaid card for at reception. If this is too much, there are also internet cafes around the corner that are at half the cost. They accommodate rides to and from the Fiumicino airport, which I requested via email. Upon arrival, we were greeted to a driver who waited with our name on a placard. We paid 60 euro for the ride. On our departure, we decided to take the Trenitaly train. We prepaid the day before and was a half hour ride at 28 euro. We enjoyed our stay there and would definitely consider going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Augusta Lucilla Palace Hotel-Not As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: marlowstevens
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid for this Hotel through Agoda as advertised as Four Star. Is not a Four Star. Is dirty and dusty and uncomfortable. Air-Con did not work and walls are paper thin. The curtains/drapes were covered in dust.

Reviews.Title: “A really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: olgilch
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets the basic requirements of a traveler - location and service, first and foremost. Very clean room (which is always very important), friendly and helpful staff , a decent breakfast, and overall a safe place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Rome”
Reviews.Author: speedingkoala
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights at the end of March. The hotel is excellent. We had a large room on the 5th floor with a small balcony. It was clean, tidy, and simply perfect. The Front Office, and all other staff was very friendly. The breakfast was not so good, but if you are looking for a few days in Rome I would really recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Modern”
Reviews.Author: CathandPeteBucks
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the location of the Augusta Lucilla Palace is ideal for Termini with its train, Metro, bus and taxi connections. We also picked up one of the open top bus tours that start and finish there. If this is not enough, reception will book you a shuttle ride to the airport, door-to-door for 14 Euro per person. The Reception staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The room was small, but spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet even though it overlooked the street. On the downside, the hotel has no restaurant, only a breakfast room and there were no coffee or tea making facilities in the room. However there are several restaurants within a few steps from the hotel. We would recommend three: "Trattora Cecio" on Via Principe Amedeo - small and reasonably expensive,but excellent food. Get Reception to make a reservation as it is always busy; "Gallina Bianca" on Via A Rosnini - reasonably priced with a Bistro feel. "Bar Washington" on Via Del Viminale - cheap but good quality. The buffet breakfast was disappointing. The hot buffet was cold and the coffee was dreadful. Stick with the cold meats and pastries. All in all, not a four star hotel, but none the less a clean, basic place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel in hotel area near Termini”
Reviews.Author: Sininenpilvi
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms including bathroom were very clean and nice, and a reasonable size for a city like Rome. Even in February the room stayed warm. Only complaints in room would be the small TV. The breakfast was more three stars than four. Fresh baked goods but no fresh fruit or vegetables or even proper juice! I might stay in this hotel as the location was very convenient and the smaller street quiet (Rome standard).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Vmeireles
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to the termini station. The room was small but always clean. Breafast was good and the staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel, so consider what you are paying for!”
Reviews.Author: AnnG_and_SteveP
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of other good quality 4 star hotels near the Termini Roma station to chose from if this particular location is important to you. We would not stay here again as, for a 4 star hotel, the room was incredibly small and quite claustrophobic, the breakfast selection was more like "school dinners" and the range of facilities was poor ( e.g. a small uncomfortable hotel lounge and no evening restaurant ). We stayed here before catching the train to Civitavecchia for a cruise back to Southampton. If we stayed in Rome again, we would still stay close to the Termini Station, but not here.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: lucreziac
Reviews.Content: We travelled in September with 2 teenagers and were given a quad room. The room was beautiful, large and clean. Each of my children had their own beds and the breakfast was so good. We also had friends staying at the same hotel at the same time! and they too had the quad room, exactly the same. The location you cannot beat, as we were walking distance from the train station and the metro. I must say the staff really were exceptional and spoke really good english. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with kids as it is so hard to find a decent hotel for a family of 4 without going to the expense of getting 2 rooms. We will definately stay here again, loved the Augusta Lucille Palace!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: rafalc84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Augusta Lucilla for two nights, and I must say I am a bit disappointed. The hotel itself is fine, but it definitely does not rise to 4 star standard. The room was very small - it was really difficult to move between bed and wardrobe.. The service was very average. I have ordered a bucket of ice to the room twice. Once I got it immediately, once I was given a small bowl with ice and I have been told that next time I need to pay for that.. Also no iron or laundry services available - a bit low standard for this price and supposed quality of 4 star hotel. Not mentioning the breakfast served in the morning. The worst coffee I ever had in Rome or Italy...Overall the stay was OK, the location of this hotel is an advantage, but the rest is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dafyddrees88
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, around 100 metres from the Termini. Great service. All staff were well-spoken with their English. Extremely clean, homely. Excellent room, well maintained and spotless.Modern and contemporary. Breakfast was average but that was probably because we slept late in the comfy beds and there was nothing left!! Possibly the best cup of coffee in Rome and we had lots! Relatively cheap taxi ride from the airport as-well. Overall, a great hotel and would recommend to everyone travelling to Rome, we just wish we could take this hotel with us on our holidays in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Average to good - but great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelure0
Reviews.Content: I was on a solo trip to Rome to unwind and explore... for the first time. Found this hotel to be fairly basic, but clean enough. It was expensive I thought for what it was, but you're paying for the central location. Was glad I was solo as my double room was pretty small. Also, wi fi in the room was out of order for the whole time I was there with little effort to do anything about it. The staff in the lobby were professional but not really that friendly. They weren't trying at all, one got the sense, but then does anyone need to pull out the stops in Rome! In conclusion, it's a good base, to explore from and has okay places to eat out nearby if you're taking a break on your own, but it's a base, not something at all to languish in.

Reviews.Title: “Teribble experience”
Reviews.Author: MrsC7119
Reviews.Content: It was a most horrible experience that we had at this hotel. The room was small and dimly lighted. There were insufficient lights in the room and when we drew back to curtains, we realised the reason for the insufficient lights. The carpet was stained and looks dirty and the wallpaper was patchy! The bathroom is equally small and there is no space to place our toiletries in the shower cubicle. We had to keep opening the shower cubicle door to get our toiletries while showering. There was a day when the room was not made up when we came back to the room in the afternoon. We then requested for them to clean the room, when we came back in the evening we realised that the room was not cleaned! They had straighten the bedsheets and given us fresh towels but we can see that the sheets were crumpled. The breakfast at this hotel was also the worse we had in Italy. The eggs and bacon were cold, coffee was not fresh and the service at breakfast was non-existent. It was essentially a self service cafeteria. We end up having our breakfast at our own expense outside the hotel after experiencing it the first day. The last straw was on the day of our check out. Check out time was 12noon as usual and we were about to go down when the electricity was cut off in the room! Prior to that we can hear the chambermaid taking a call in the hall (the walls were that thin) confirming that we are still in the room etc. We had never experienced hotels cutting off the electricity once it's passed the check out time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tejashree
Reviews.Content: Luckly we were put in Augusta lucilia palace...we had our booking in hotel splendid. When we reached Rome the rude manager of Hotel Spledid sent us to Augusta Lucilia saying that the shower of the room which we had booked is not working.. after a long and tiring trip from India this type of behaviour was shocking..it was raining outside and we had to go to augusta lucilia..but to our surprise this hotel turned out very very good...the rooms were beautifully decorated the bathroom was very good...the manager and the other staff members were very friendly and helped us to plan our city tours well...the breakfast was also good. Infact augusta was better placed than splendid, just few blocks away from termini.. absolutely a good experience...thanks augusta lucilia staff.... Tejashree Datey Mumbai, India

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: travelling46
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located because it is near the train station, so you won't have to walk long distances if you arrive to rome from the airport and take the train to the city. It is also near underground stations and buses. If you want to take a sightseing tour, it also begins near the train station so, as far as transportation is concerned, you'll be fine. The hotel was recently renwed so everything looks new and clean. They have different types of rooms. If you're going there be sure to ask for a room facing the street (don't worry, the double glazed window muffle the street sounds completely), otherwise you may find yourself (as we did) in a room that faces an inner yard, quite small and stuffy. This room was so small you couldn't open the bathroom door completely before it hit your bed... We asked for another room and the staff was quite nice to change us into a bigger, brighter one. The bed was comfortable, big. There was no bathtub but the shower was enough. Bath towels were small and very, very thin. The room had an LCD Tv, so small you have to wear glasses to watch it... and they only had four channels (an italian one, a japaneseone, CNN and BCC world news!!!!). There aren't many drawers to put your clothes in, but as we went in the summer, clothes don't occupy that much space. So, yes I could say the hotel is fine, clean, well located, comfortable, etc. Unfortunately it had the worst breakfast I've ever tried in my life. They have most of the things you can expect from a 4star rated hotel - like eggs, bacon and sausages - but everything was so badly cooked and bad quality we only had breakfast there on the first 3 days of our one-week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: 2MNtravelers_JnA
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with this hotel. The service was very friendly and provided lots of information. They even gave us bags of breakfast for us when we said we were leaving before their breakfast time began. The only small downside was in our rooms, we had to get used to a bathtub. There was no shower. Rub a dub dub we had to scrub in a tub. (although the tub had nice whirlpool jets) I would recommend this place. It's location near the train station is very convenient

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Hospitarity”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo-Rome
Reviews.Content: A few minutes from Termini station, easier to go every site of Rome. Housekeepers always smiled at us when we meet them ain the hotel. Receptions also were so kind to us that they advised how to go to Fiumicino Airport. This is a very TripAdvisor !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location to explore all Rome has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: GordoTheViking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in June. The hotel's location is great for the Termini station, and is within walking distance of all the major sites in Rome. We managed to cover the whole area on foot although the busses and metro are very convenient for those less able to walk. The hotel staff were very helpful, but not overly forthcoming. If you ask them for advice they would gladly give it as well as booking restaurants and taxis. Don't expect them to say "have a nice day" or make too much effort unless you approach them. This obviously isn't the done thing in Rome. The breakfast was adequate, and enough to keep us going. The choice is fairly limited but the europeans seemed to like it. It was ok for us too. Our room was always spotless as was the rest of the hotel. Check out the wall paper, It's made of fabric!! But who goes to Rome to spend time in their hotel? I would definately recommend this hotel to friends with the understanding that this is not what you would expect from a four star hotel in the UK. That said you only have to look at the price to know that this isn't going to be a luxury hotel. Good value is probably the best way to describe it. Get it booked and enjoy Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GR-India
Reviews.Content: Not a very big hotel but was neat and the location is very convenient as it is close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: UnworldlyTraveler
Reviews.Content: With under three days in Rome, my partner and I needed a hotel that was centrally located so we could maximize our time. Augusta Lucilla Palace was a fine choice. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is located very close to Termini Station, making it easy to catch a train to other cities in Italy or to catch the Metro line to the major tourist attractions in Rome. Although some people have described the area around Termini as sketchy, I never felt unsafe walking around at night. The neighborhood is touristy full of small hotels, so I imagine it's relatively well-policed. Our double room on the top floor was very modern, with a sparkling bathroom and working A/C. However, it was extremely small (not uncommon for Italy) -- there was just enough room to walk around the bed and not much more. We did not encounter any problems with noise at night. The hotel staff was helpful, providing maps and making calls to museums for reservations. Their attitude was very much a down-to-business one, though, so don't expect to be greeted with warm smiles and inquiries about your stay. The dining room was large, with many breakfast options -- sliced meats, eggs, croissants, juice, yogurt, fruit salad, etc. The pastries were sometimes burnt and much of the fruit obviously came from a can. You're not going to be blown away by breakfast, but it's edible and can hold you over. (Also on the subject of food: Don't expect too much from the restaurants in the immediate vicinity -- they cater to tourists and the food is subpar.) There is a charge for using Wi-fi. Augusta Lucilla Palace isn't going to be memorable, but it is up to modern standards and is situated in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINTESS1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within 2 blocks or Termini which is the central depot for travel in Rome. We walked with our suitcases to the hotel after taking the train from Fiumicino. The hotel was very quiet at night, the air conditioning worked(hooray as it was 90 degrees outside) the rooms were surprisingly spacious, there were many nice eateries, and it was within a 15 to 20 minute walk to the majority of the cities famous sites. My husband,daughter, her boy friend and I shared a very spacious suite. Would happily stay there again if the occasion arose. They also had a great tear off map that was our "bible" for our stay. Make sure to make reservations in advance for Vatican Museum. It is worth every penny as you walk past the hundreds of people broiling in line in the hot sun!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for Rome and transportation”
Reviews.Author: Hdeborah
Reviews.Content: We found reception staff very helpful and they spoke excellent English. Breakfast plentiful but boring. This was a good location as we were going out of the Terminii Station to Civitavechia to join a cruise. Many restaurants within a short distance of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: C27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Augusta Lucilla Palace for 3 nights during our stay in Rome. The room was comfortable as was the bed. The bathroom was a little on the small-ish side but was extremely clean! The front-desk staff were helpful and was able recommend several restaurants. The breakfast was just ok. I did not expect much, so my expectations of the breakfast was not diminished. The location was extremely convenient, about a two minute walk to the main train station and bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Everything ok”
Reviews.Author: GemmaEspoo
Reviews.Content: Good choice. Location could have been a bit more closer to the attractions, but easy walking distance everywhere still. Rooms were clean, quite spacious and quiet. Breakfast was also good. Only problem was that we had two separate beds (but that was to be expected in the reservation).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quite and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: stekes
Reviews.Content: Only bad thing was internet. they only had wi-fi to pay and "its from another company" as the receptionist said, so there were problems with the cards and username / passwords that they provided. moreover my cart seemed to have less time than the one purchased. The stuff was very helpfull, breakfast was complete and the rooms were big enough and clear. Location was very good and very close to TERMINI station which has anything (metro, bus, train, hop on/off busses)

Reviews.Title: “robbing & cut-throat”
Reviews.Author: ankernewek
Reviews.Content: Unable to stay here due to flight disruption Kept them up to date as best i could via e.mail regarding possible disruption to travel due to ash from volcano. they never once responded to my mails as soon as easy jet cancelled the flight i contacted them again. they still charged me 330 euro never stay with here is my advise. cant say what the hotel was like...never got there, and never will now!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, did the job!”
Reviews.Author: Dancingtigga
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it offered, modern decor, quadruple rooms and was in a central location. Agree with the others - breakfast was poor, very poor. Orange squash masquerading as fruit juice - sent our kids loopy. Plastic cheese, processed ham, stale bread, undrinkable coffee - by the forth morning of our stay we couldn't face it anymore and if you've ever gone looking for breakfast in Rome, you'll realise that it's not something the Italians are big into - unless you fancy a cake, or a coffee while you stand at a counter. We were so desperate we even tried McDonalds but again a cake was the only thing on offer. So the poor quality of the breakfast is probably more important that it first seemed - as there is little alternative offered by nearby cafes. In subsequent hotels we stayed in the standard of breakfast was much higher, so I wouldn't agree that it's a typical continental breakfast. Fix the breakfast and we'd return - until then no way!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: IrishLouise12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 100 meters from the Terimni Station, which is central for almost everything except maybe the Vatican which is a good 40 minute walk away - we got the metro line. The hotel itself is quite ok, free continental breakfast in the morning is basic, but it will set you up for the day. The issue I had with the hotel was the location, there were a lot of homeless people around, and at night in the dark, it was quite intimidating. We were two single girls, and it was a bit nerve wracking at times. The hotel is very good value for money, and the rooms while small, are very clean. The shower is great, really powerful.

Reviews.Title: “Better Value Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Tripaholics57
Reviews.Content: Augusta Lucilla Palace Hotel Yes it has just been refitted and is very clean and tidy. The rooms a very small as is the bathroom. However the Buffet breakfast is possibly the worst I have ever had in over thirty years of travel. For this room rate you can do a lot better for your dollar elsewhere. Four star it's not, no room service bar not part of the hotel so no charge back just small things but the value is just not there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: charlieandcharles
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't fancy, if you're expecting a five star hotel type place, go else where. This hotel is located blocks from the Termini Station which is convenient coming from Fumicino Airport as well as the numerous subways. The Colloseum isn't too far of a walk either, as well as the Spanish Steps. If you're looking to save some money and stay at a clean, decent hotel, this is it. Besides, who spends all day inside a hotel when you're visiting Europe? You're out all the time enjoying the country!

Reviews.Title: “No frills but great price for a great location”
Reviews.Author: haolepino
Reviews.Content: Disclosure: We travel with two small children, so I'm generally looking for a four-person room, which isn't easy to find at a good price. This hotel offered a good price for a four-person room in Rome, but its location is what sold me. And the maps didn't lie. This hotel--even with two small children in tow--is truly only two minutes from the Termini metro station. An additional minute gets you into the Termini building itself. Why is this useful? 1) Rome's two metro lines only cross here. And 2) there is a taxi stop and a bus station hub at Termini. Let me also join the fray in heartily agreeing with everyone that this is a solid 3-star, not a 4-star, but with modest 3-star pricing, were you really expecting a 4-star? As for the breakfast, I have to say that the breakfast should be evaluated by European standards. This is a European hotel, after all. In the breakfast room, you'll hear many Italians, a LOT of Spaniards, some French-speakers and Eastern Europeans and only a smattering of English-speakers. You'll notice that the Europeans seem to be enjoying their breakfast just fine. They understand that to get a latte, they have to mix the very thick almost syrupy black coffee with the milk (conveniently kept hot for you in a boiler) in a carafe and take it to their table. Also, why would you expect your bacon to be cooked American style (crispy) at a non-American hotel? *Tip*: If the coffee bothers you that much and you don't want to make your own latte, you can nicely ask the breakfast-room attendant to make you a cappuccino at the professional coffee machine in the bar, as at least one Spanish family did every morning. ;o) But if you ask her for a latte, she'll just point you to the coffee and milk dispensers. What you get at this hotel: * Perfect location--quiet--and less than 5 minutes to Termini. This is also a l10-minute walk from Santa Maria Maggiore, one of the major churches of Rome. You could also walk to the Colosseum and Roman Forum in 20 minutes or so, but the metro is so convenient and inexpensive. There are also oodles of excellent restaurants in the adjacent street--Via Principe. * A quiet room, with walls that are padded and fabric-lined, making for a peaceful night. * Breakfast included. Although some reviewers were less pleased with this feature, our four-person family found something to eat every morning. And if you set your standards to a European Continental breakfast, you'll find many choices. * Friendly staff. * A minibar that you can use to keep something small cold if you move things around. * A safe in your room. What you will NOT get: * Free Internet access--in fact, a 1-hour access code will cost you 5 euro. * A business center with a printer. Although there is a single terminal for which you can purchase access. * An in-house restaurant for lunch or dinner. * A gym. * A pool. * Easy parking--at least not that I could see. But this is the hotel for a group intending to make full use of the public transport system, which is not as extensive as some other European cities' but certainly one of the most affordable. Overall, the location is tough to beat. Especially with small children who don't want to walk long to the metro or to dinner. And the price was tough to top in that neighborhood as well. Especially for a family of four that requires a quad room. If you adjust your expectations to a 3-star and need a decently priced room close to Termini, this hotel might just fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: biology44
Reviews.Content: Great, well priced hotel. We stayed for 7 nights. Rooms were very free from noise from other rooms but we did get some traffic noise from the street. Italians LOVE to blow their horns! The hotel made reservations for us at the Borghese gallery and the staff were very nice to us (unlike what others have posted). Maybe they are not used to the Italian culture. The only downside would be no free wireless access. I think they would please a lot more people if they just added a few euro to the room cost and gave everyone free internet. OK breakfast. Room and bath are a typical size by European standards. I was impressed that our room was always cleaned by time we arrived back (Even when we came back after a late start and were only gone a few hours) and housekeeping never knocked on our door and woke us up even when we slept in late (unlike other places I have stayed). The bed was firm but not too firm that it hurt your joints. The location CANNOT be beat. We were a three minute walk from the metro, busses and the train station. Rome involves a lot of walking but using public transport helps to save your feet! Go to the restaurant Babbo's on the street behind the Baths of Diocletian. The best steak and well priced at 17 euro! This hotel had nice toiletries, towel warmer (to dry clothes on!) and nice big towels. The restaurant and bar are not that great so do not expect to have a great time there but why stay in your hotel with other tourists when you have all of Rome and its people to explore? We were extremely pleased with our choice and would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, silence rooms, phonic isolated, excelent bed, nice bathroom”
Reviews.Author: alinaSibiu
Reviews.Content: We realy enjoyed our stay in Augusta, the location is perfect, we had a inside view room, I recomend for silence obsessed like us, breakfast is lets say 3*, but everything else compensate for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hardly a 4* hotel, and avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Shell995
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location only a few minutes walk from the termini station and about a 20 minute walk from the trevi fountain and from the colloseum aswell. the room was smaller than we expected but for what we needed was perfectly fine, the bed was extreamly comfortable and to behonest after an entire day walking around rome thats the main thing you need. the room and bathroom look very nice, although our shower did leak, but was fixed by using two of the hand towels on the floor. the staff however, especially on the main desk, i found to be unhelpful and some what rude. The morning breakfast was somewhat of a joke, the little choice of cooked food (mini sausages, bacon and discusting scrambled eggs) was some thing we didnt touch after our first morning simply due to how revulting the eggs were. the rest of the food is edible but nothing your going to want to stock too much up on mainly consisting of the usual bland continental type food, all with very little taste. The rooms were very well kept by the cleanin staff though. Getting around rome was fairly easy although if your in a wheel chair or find it hard to walk around easily rome may not be the best place for you as it is not disable friendly at all. Pick pockets were avoided by making sure you have a zipped bag and keeping hold of the zip end at all times. Rome is a very very beautiful place, and me and my boyfriend highly recomend the tour for the colloseum and palatine hill and roman forum which cost us around £25 for all 3 with guides. the metro is very cheap and easy to use, 1 euro for a ticket although they get very cramded but a new one is usually due only 1 minute after the previous.(if only london was as quick:) ) Over all the only thing that would stop me returning was the staff at the hotel, they were very rude. Our check out time was meant to be 12 but at 10.30 the key card which is used to activate the lights etc in the room was deactivated with no warning what so ever! go to rome, stay near the termini station by all means but be careful with this hotel, although if your not bothered but unfriendly staff and a rather dodgey breakfast the rooms were comfy enough to say go to, maybe youll be luckier than we were. Getting from the airport (fuimicini-spelt wrong probably sorry :) ) we got a 8 euro bus, which took about 45 minutes but was comfy enough and the cheapest option, findin the bus stop was interesting at the tuourist info office were rude and un helpful and as of every thing else in rome it was not well sign posted (serious map skills are needed in rome) the bus stops right next to termini station. on the way back we took the train, very comfy and at 11 euros it was quick at only 30 mins (non stop) and also departed ontime.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Vierdank
Reviews.Content: I can't really understand all the very positive reviews of this hotel. There's nothing special about it. Termini is a hotel area with hundreds of hotels. As said by other reviewers it is clean with a nice staff and a good location. So are dozens of three star hotels, but this one has four! A four star hotel does not have the bar driven by another company (making it impossible to put the tabs on the room), does not charge 5 EUR for 1h Wi-Fi, do not have door locks with both physical keys and keycards (which was very hard to produce in the reception). A four star hotel: has a bit of class (sometimes a lot), has high quality beds, pay attention to details and serve drinkable coffe at breakfast - especially in the country of espresso... Go elsewhere if you're looking for four REAL stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & Location to Termini. Recommend. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: HavnfunOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in November 2009 before starting repositioning cruise. Location is great. An easy walk to Termini. We walked to most venues. It is situated down a side street that runs parallel to a main street ( Carvour ??) that runs straight down to the Forum area. Easy access to subway thru the Termini. There is a market store in the lower level of the Termini where you can grabs some water, snacks etc. and many restaurants nearby. We liked "il Tavolinetto" restaurant on 46 via D'Azeglio # 46. Go out Hotel entrance , turn left and walk to the next corner ( 50 meters?) and it is right on the corner. The hotel is clean, and quiet and near many other hotels. The rooms are modern and well furnished but I would agree with a previous writer about the smaill showers. Not a problem..but smaller than North American standards. Staff were friendly and reactive to any request we made. Breakfast is ok. We found that the bacon was almost never cooked well and we found that in two other Italian hotels so it must be a custom on how to cook bacon. Otherwise, you can get a reasonably filling breakfast to allow you to start your day. We returned late evening each night and always walked to the hotel. A quiet street, but never felt uneasy. We would recommend the Augusta and would certainly stay there again on our next visit especially since we now know how close it is to many attractions if you don't mind walking. In hindsight, we should have probably taken the hop-on, hop-off bus and the subway more often so as to spend more time at the attractions but we love to explore the side streest etc. and meet many interesting people and find little "treasures" of places and restaurants that would not be found by many tourists. It was a great visit and we will do it again in the near future. Have fun and enjoy. !!!

Reviews.Title: “very good!!”
Reviews.Author: amaliaChania
Reviews.Content: It was a very good hotel, clean and quiet not far from downtown. The staff was friendly and helpfull, and the bathroom new..! The only minus was the small reception and the bar of the hotel...(didn't exist!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ClemScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Augusta Lucilla Palace hotel, Rome for 4 nights over new year. Hotel very close to Termini Station but in a nice, safe area with many other hotels and good restaurants (non touristy). Had a triple room, which was slightly on the small side however, adequate for our needs. The room was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable, if a little hot (the air conditioning could not be used in the winter months) Brakfast was included in our stay and there was plenty of food on offer, including cooked and continental selections. Staff were kind and helpful - they recommended a great little restaurant for us on our first night. Overall, this hotel was value for money. We had a pleasant, quiet stay and all major sights were within close reach (could walk to the Colosseum in 10 minutes and Trevi Fountain in 20).

Reviews.Title: “Would not refund our money even though we cancelled within 24 hrs.”
Reviews.Author: MackeyToronto
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked 2 nights by mistake instead of one. We cancelled the one night within 24 hrs however to this date we have not received the refund even though the hotel manager assured us in Sept. 2009 it would be coming. Also, someone tried our door at 4:00 a.m., the construction stated at 7:00 am, so it was not a great night. It was a continental breakfast only, so not very good for the money spent. Our friends stayed at a cheaper hotel with much better results.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: William095
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a decent location, right next to the main railway station and was perfect for the bus to and from Ciampino Airport. We walked to many of the sights all over the city from the hotel, a fair bit of walking. Don't let that put you off. On arrival at hotel at midday our room was ready. The staff at reception were efficient and well mannered. We had a corner room on the fourth floor looking out onto adjoining street. Double glazing cut out lots of noise (Rome is noisy with traffic and they like sounding their horns !). The room was medium size with comfy bed. The room was very clean as was the bathroom, the only minor complaint was the layout of the bathroom, the shower door open onto the toilet and restricted access a bit, but not a major problem. The buffet breakfast was pretty good with the usual cold selections and some hot choices. The hotel only had a small bar area and no other amenities, but that said we were sightseeing so the hotel choice was good. We stayed for five nights and other than the bathroom design, we had no complaints and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Little_Lemon
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. Convenient to the train station. Breakfast was okay, not great, but did provide some variety.

Reviews.Title: “A night in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP7
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Near the train station, convenient for travel. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel but not a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: LizzzzyZ
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4-day stay in the Augusta Lucilla Palace in Rome. Whilst this was a nice, and clean hotel, this is definitely not a 4-star ranking. We had a nice bedroom, quite spacious, with double-bed and enough wooden hangers for all our clothes. There was a lovely bathroom with an even lovelier shower but no bath. My fault laid in the breakfast. Lack of fresh fruit - meant we actually bought our own and took it into the breakfast room. The daily choice of Tinner Fruit Salad, Tinned Pineapple Rings and Ring Prunes/Plums was just not nice. There were plastic packets of the thinnest cheese imaginable - and you often had to fight with the plastic to get the cheese out. There were a selection of rolls, breads and pastries but we found that the baskets a bit off-pointing as they over-hung the bacon hot plates. There was a corn flake which were not corn flakes, natural yoghurt and some dried up cake. There was ample supply of water for teas and a nice selection of teas, plus coffee and hot milk. The hotel was in a good location - 5 minutes to the railyway station and metro - though we walked most places. The Colissium is about 20 minute walk away, and the main shopping street about 15 - once you get your bearings. The hotel was located in what I can only call a hotel neighbourhood as every other building seemed to be a hotel - some which appeared nicer than ours, some worse. There were some restaurants in the area but these all seemed to close by 11 pm. We arrived 10ish on Wednesday evening, and thought we'd get a bite in the neighbourhood as we were hungrey - nothing was open. We walked back to the station - nothing open. We then went back to the hotel and ordered some teas at the bar. We couldn't charge out hotel account as it was a separate entity from the hotel, and they only took cash too. There was a restaurant in the hotel - where one took breakfast - which I can honestly say I never saw anyone eat in. The staff appeared friendly - but never really acknowledged you as you and went on your way - day or night. They all spoke relatively OK English. Just watch the step leading to the staircase and lift. Tripped up on it a few times as it was quite a shallow step and not indicated. I have no complaints about this as such - breakfast withstanding - but I thought we did pay too much money for a 4 nights stay. I'd have not minded if the hotel qualified for 4-star status - but having stayed in 4 and 5 stars before, I'd have expected something a little more for our money and at least fresh fruit for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Rosiee_09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in September 09 for 5 nights and loved it. The staff were very friendly and helpful with directions especially the gentlemen at the reception. The hotel was two minutes away from the termini station and tour buses, and our room was a reasonable size. When you arrive at the airport, take the train to Roma termini station. DON'T take the coaches that take you straight outside because it's a waste of money and the drivers do NOT know where they are going! There are THREE mcDonalds near the hotel which was really convenient for us as we eat alot. On the last night, our shower head broke but the staff at the hotel quickly fixed and replaced it for us. The only downfall would be breakfast. There were eggs, bacon, sausages and cold meats.. Some fruits, croissants and cereal but it wasn't upto 4star standards.
