Bacon was a bit undercooked and sausages were more like hotdogs. Croissants were also a little hard. The hotel is about 15/20 minutes walk away from roman forums and colosseum. My boyfriend and I walked literally everywhere except to the vatican city because it was abit too far away. There were alot of nice restaurants next to the hotel which were quite cheap and the food was good too. I would definitely recommend this hotel =D

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aingealban
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, great location for main railway station and metro. Breakfast wasn't overly exciting but was fine - 4 types of juice, tea/coffee, tinned fruits, selection of cold meats, pastries, bread, jams, eggs, sausages, bacon - enough to keep you going until lunch!. Rooms were spotless, showers were normal size to us, we had no problems. Staff were professional and friendly. Nice location, great restaurants all around if you didn't want to bother going further afield. The the Santa Maria Maggigore Bassilica is quite nearby - around a couple of corners. There is a great woodfire restaurant called the Chicken Hut about 5 mins up the road (behind the basillica - opposite a chinese restaurant). Wouldn't recommend the hotel bar, they didn't have much of a selection and prices were quite expensive... no atmosphere either, nobody used it. When I looked on the hotel website, it said something about a rooftop terrace but on investigation - it was nothing more than an empty space, no tables or chairs - pity really, could have been really nice if they had made an effort with it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Okay Value and Service, Close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Autum07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Augusta Lucilla Palace during the Rome leg of our Italy vacation earlier this month. The hotel was clean, the bed was comfortable. The shower was not ideal, it is very small and the doors make it awkward and the shower head wouldn't stay put. Putting the shower aside though, the room was good and we had a good value for a four star hotel. The reception desk was helpful, they gave us a good map and a few recommendations on restaurants near the hotel (neither my husband or I cared for the breakfast at the hotel). The service from reception was average; the service was in line with what we received in all of Italy (when you have service expectations based on staying in US hotels). I think the location is good because you have quick access to Termini Station for heading anywhere where the Metro runs. However, the hotel is not so great a location for going to the Pantheon and surrounding area or to the areas where the locals eat/shop (for example, Jewish Ghetto). The Metro doesn't run there, so you have to take the bus (which is fine but my husband and I prefer the Metro). If I go back to Rome, I would stay somewhere closer to the Pantheon area as we felt that we kept taking buses and not using the Metro so often.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: popiSyros
Reviews.Content: Very good location, close to bus station and metro. Clean hotel, sheets and towels were changed every day. Staff was very helpfull. Our triple room had two bedrooms, the right size and classic decoration except bathroom that it was modern although shower was too small. Breakfast was ok with a variety of breads, cold meat, cereals and cakes. The only negative point was the noise every morning but i think that it was temporary (maybe works of repairs). I would recommend this hotel to visitors with young children and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ...”
Reviews.Author: BikerBear143
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice on business - very close to Termini (main railway station), walking distance from other attractions although recommend a taxi to visit the Vatican, St Peter's or The Spanish Steps unless you enjoy walking and are pretty fit. Hotel staff always helpful and breakfast more than adequate. Avoid the restaurants anywhere near the Termini - overpriced and not the best quality. Hotel downside: No tea/coffee facilites in the room. My tip: ask for a corner room on a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: lovec33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice in a very good location. Ten min. walk to Colosseo and to all attractives. Termini station is two min from hotel , very convinient. The hotel was nice and clean. It was recently renovated and looks very nice and new. We book a double room, was nice but little small. The breakfast was very nice, a lot of choice of hot and cold things. The staff was very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again! Nice hotel & great location.”
Reviews.Author: 888traveler
Reviews.Content: From Termini Station, this hotel is very easy to find. Their front desk staff was very helpful gladly answered all our touristy questions. They also provided us with free maps of the city. Although small, our room was very clean and well maintained with nice furniture. The bed was outfitted with crisp & clean white sheets and the bathroom, which was also very clean, had nice fixtures and included toiletries. The only complain I have is that the shower stall is quite tight and narrow so it was a bit difficult to shower. Their breakfast is also by far, the best out of all the 5 hotels we stayed at in Italy. They offered scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, an assortment of cold cuts and cheese, fresh yogurt, a variety of cereal, tea, coffee and a variety of breads.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Angelique_op_Reis.
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 5 night stay in hotel Augusta Lucilla Palace in Rome. We arrived on 29th of July and left on the 3rd of August 2009. After reading the reviews of this hotel, we decided to book this hotel including a returnflight with KLM Royal Dutch Airlines. We had an early flight in the morning and arrived at 09.00 am at Fiumicino Airport (Leonardo da Vinci airport) in Rome. We could pick up our luggage very soon. We left the baggage hall through the EU gate (no passport control) and then walked towards the station of Fiumicino which was very easy to find. Just follow the pictograms! We bought our traintickets for the Leonardo Express to Rome Termini station which costs 11 Euro per person. We validated the tickets before getting on the train which leaves at 10.05 am. The journey takes about 30 minutes to Rome Termini Station. The train arrived at platform 25. Walk straight and follow the exit Piazza Cincquecento. Passed the white taxis, accross the streat on your left and walk straight. Passed the busstation and the subway station and then, the first street on your left is Via Massimo d’Aglezio. It’s very easy to find. There are many places to eat in the station and just outside the station such as McDonalds. The hotel is next to hotel Nizza and it was no problem to check in early. The receptionist offered a room on the 3rd floor. We asked for a twin bedded room on the 5th floor with a balcony. We had to wait just one hour for the room. Our room was clean, no muffy carpet on the floor, but a wooden floor, the beds were good, the bathroom was clean. See the pictures attached! When we opened the doors for the balcony, we could hear the traffic but when we closed it, it was really quiet! We had a good night sleep without any noise during our stay. Facilities in our room: - A big closet including a safe - Table including a mini bar, chair and mirror, - Airconditioning - Flat sreen TV ( we watched CNN and MTV) - Telephone - Bidet (this was very nice after walking through the days) - A side table for our luggage. - Toilet - Shower (no bath) The breakfast buffet was included. Breakfast was from 07.00 – 10.00 am. There was plenty of food such as croissants (very dry), white bread rolls, yoghurt, cornflakes, scrambled eggs, sausages, cheese, ham, pineapple, fruitcocktail, cakes, coffee, tea and juice machines (very sour). Unfortunately there was no micro wave for the croissants and bread rolls :( Rome is a very nice city. We visited the following highlights; Vaticancity, the Colosseo, Foro Romano, Fontana di Trevi, Pantheon, Campo de’fiori, Piazza Navona, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza Venezia, Piazza della Republica (close to the hotel), Santa Maria Maggiore, Spanish steps including a free walking tour, Via Condotti and a daytrip to Firenze on the 1st of August. We enjoyed our stay in Rome and Firenze. We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is not their Strong Point”
Reviews.Author: ScubaNinja
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a nice location, within walking distance of the Termini and Some really beautiful sights. Overall however I left the hotel quite annoyed by the Staff, in particular the man at reception, who in my opinion needs to seriously brush up on his customer service skills. I was attending a wedding in Rome and needed to Iron my shirt and trousers as they had been squashed into a bag for the flight. Apparently for Fire Safety Reasons you can no longer get an Iron and Ironing Board in your room. Now this is fair enough if it is the law, however, when I inquired about an iron at reception the Receptionist spoke to me like I was a simpleton and offered me no reason other than raising his shoulders and claiming that it was not his problem. He then preceded to laugh at me when I said that this was not stated on the website and that I was not happy about the situation. To top it all off when we were checking out he was even ruder saying that we needed to pay the balance. We were under the impression that we had prepaid and since it did not state either way whether we had I asked could I use their internet to check my online banking to see if it had been charged. He again stared blankly at me and raised his shoulders in the now all too familiar gesture of 'I am not going to help you at all so why do you keep expecting me to?'. I was welcome to use the internet as long as I paid for the privilege. For a finish he didn't charge me as I was staring to get quite irate and asking to see the manager. All in all the hotel was nice, clean, and the breakfast was palatable. The cleaners tried to come into our room at nine in the morning and then never came back to clean the room after we had left but that's happened in so many hotels I wouldn't hold that against them. I will not be recommending it to anyone I know nor will I ever visit the hotel again. For the simple reason that I felt like I was treated rather badly and I do not understand how someone so obviously rude and ignorant can work as the Public Face of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not to sure about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Youngcouple7879
Reviews.Content: This hotel had so many good points but so many bad ones as well. Firstly good; It was located about a 5-10 minute walk from the train station so as we travelled by train this was really easy for us. The Coloseum was also close however the vatican, spanish steps etc was a little walk - we ended up getting a taxi to the vatican which was really easy and didn't cost too much. The rooms were big and clean however the bed was a little hard - otherwise the rooms were perfect. Great internet cafe/laundry-mat nearby called undablu. Bad points; Staff in my opinion were not very friendly, didn't offer a map like all other hotels I had been to on my trip had so we had to find one and work out were things were on our own, the free internet was slow and didn't work properly, they didn't allow acces to hotmail which was unlucky for me as all our european trip details were on my hotmail. We purchased a nice bottle of wine to enjoy in our room from a lovely shop around the corner, but when I called reception for a corkscrew and ice they told me I had to go to the bar, we went to the bar and they said that they had no ice (!!!) and that we had to bring the bottle down so he could open it - it was all just too hard. Also, I think this hotel offered the worst breakfast that I have had in a hotel. There was heaps of food but nothing good - it was quantity not quality. Overall I think it was ok - clean and safe but it could be so much better it has potential.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, very good value”
Reviews.Author: bragelus
Reviews.Content: Near Termini, place is nice, people are friendly. If you would want to pick on something then at the time of writing breakfast was quite basic. Overall, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: realwarder
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. I must compliment the hotel on its friendly and helpful atmosphere. First, location: We found the hotel to be a great location and excellent value for money. The hotel is located about 5 mins walk from the railway station (10 mins from the platform that goes to Rome Airport). This was incredibly convenient when arriving at FCO as we simply got the train into Rome and then walked to the hotel. Out of the station, go right up the hill and then turn left past just where the tourist buses all stop. Tip: There is a SPAR shop as you leave the station which has bottles of water for 0.39E rather than the 2.99E they are everywhere tourist corner shop. The hotel was kind enough to allow us to drop our bags early, enabling us to explore Rome. This exploration is helped by the tourist bus stop at the end of the street the hotel is on. (Don't worry - it's a small side street and little traffic goes by the hotel). You can get a open top bus pass for 2 days which will help with easy access down into the heart of Rome. For some reason some bus tours were twice as expensive as others - we choose the cheapest and it did everything the others did - the route is the same for all of them, they all give headphones to listen to the recorded tour guide. Proximity to the station also means quick access to the subway. In the evening, if you want more convenience and lower price travel than a taxi, the subway is a quick way to get to various parts of Rome (but not all of it). One evening though, we walked to the Colosseum and back directly - it was pleasant and didn't take as long as we thought it would - about 20 minutes each way. Note: the subway only takes cash. The breakfast was included in our rate and the hotel provided a large selection of food covering different countries food. I think they did a great job of ensuring everyone would find something they liked. The desk staff were friendly and helpful. We were joking with them as we came and went. They made us smile while being efficient at their jobs too. Other Rome tips - rather than buying lots of water, you can refill bottles from fountains all around the city. SPAR stores are tucked away hidden out of sight for the locals to use, but are much better value than the tourist stores that are on every corner. At restaurants, try and engage in Italian. The locals know you're a tourist and will often open with an English welcome - everyone speaks English, but we had much more fun when we tried to order in Italian, and it entertained both them and us :) Back to topic - this hotel was a great find - our room had been upgraded within the last couple of years and was a clean European modern style. Not massive, but far from tiny. I arrived in Rome with the small concern that the Trip Advisor reviews were made up by someone, but I would rate the hotel as excellent - our room definitely exceeded our expectations and we would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Marger50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. We found the Hotel to be extremely clean and tastefully decorated. The location is perfect for all the tourist sightseeing, transport links and restaurants. We were returning on an early morning flight to Ireland and the night manager had put aside a 'picnic breakfast' for us, without being asked, as we would miss the main beakfast - nice touch. The hotel bar needs a bit of attention in terms of customer service and is not on a par with the high standards and ambience of the rest of the hotel . We arrived early and our bagage was safely stored until we were ready to be booked in. Overall we would have no hesitation in highly recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent price, fabulous location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rebl32262
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Rome. I had booked a pricy hotel that we stayed at previously fearing the worst if I went with a cheaper place. At the last minute I took a chance and switched to the Augusta Lucilla Palace. We were not disappointed. 1st it's within 2 blocks of Termini so you can easily walk there saving taxi fare plus catching the metro to anywhere is so easy. It is mere blocks from Plaza Republicca, Santa Maria church, and the Agnes in Ectasy church. The ac is ice cold, the beds are memory foam, the pillows NOT hard, and the breakfast is good. The front desk could not have been more helpful. In short we saved $100 a night over the other hotel ($180)and were very pleased with the quality. The room and shower are standard for Europe, the price is not!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pick”
Reviews.Author: YellowBus1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really very nice. It looked like it had just been recently renovated. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The location was good and close to train and metro stations. This made it really easy to get around. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and well located.”
Reviews.Author: Luckygirl66
Reviews.Content: Minutes away from the Termini station in Rome, great location to the metro, open top buses, and the colosseum. The room size is standard for Europe and the newly renovated rooms, were extremely clean. The bathroom was lovely and I agree that the shower stall is on the smaller side, however I live in the middle east and thats just the way the shower stalls are it seems. As americans we are so used to having so much more space. The space was not an issue by any means at all. The staff was really very nice. I had not put the location on my map before the trip and then forgot to also put it on my paperwork. I had an "idea" of where the hotel was. I asked 3 people..one did not know, the second man at the barromeo hotel (what a nasty nasty man...) and then a man at the Saturnia ...he actually googled it for me and told me how to get there. Really nice thing to do. ... our first taste of Rome. During our check in the staff told us that we could get reservations and ask them any questions. Which we did over the next few days and they were wonderful with the information. The continental breakfast was fair, the coffee was not that great and the fruit was canned, yogurt came out of a machine. There was lots to choose from but it was fair...and I wish they had a coffee/tea service in the room...other than that ...it was really very nice, Very very very clean, which is a deal breaker for me. we were in room 403 and there were restaurants below us. We could not really hear them except when the musicians came out and the singer...for their nightly trip from restaurant to restaurant. All in all it was a nice place to stay. Thank you. we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: djf52
Reviews.Content: Terrific location. We are walkers so we were able to go anywhere we wanted from the hotels central location. We wheeled our suitcases from the train station (3 minutes) into the hotel. Room was a good size for european standards. It was updated and modern. View wasn't that great but we weren't there to look out the window. Breakfast was average and there were lots of choices. I am not sure if garbage day is every day but it seemed like it. 7AM we could here the garbage being picked up. Staff not overly friendly but efficient. All in all, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: yahootraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Guest rooms were modern and well appointed and looked new - not sure when the hotel opened. Great location in walking distance to the train station and sigh seeing busses we used for two days to see all of Rome. We did not make it to breakfast either day so cannot comment on that. Room & shower were small but consistent with our others hotels on this trip. Internet was not free at this hotel. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunny-c300
Reviews.Content: Pros: - photos of the hotel are not deceiving - convenient location, we walked everywhere, including going to vatican city - room is quite big, could comfortably walk around the bed - shower pressure is very good - loved the vanity - loved the coffee (the best we had in Italy), it looks very black, but it's very good, we put a lot of milk and it still looks quite black, we made our coffee with 2 part coffee 1 part milk - toiletries are replenished everyday - bed is comfortable - variety of breakfast is not bad, breakfast room is comfortable Cons: - it's awkward to sit on the toilet, because half of your thigh would end up under the vanity - shower doors don't close tightly therefore floor is always wet - shower is a little small, but this seems like european standards - when we're there early May, the A/C is not yet on, we're told they're on the switch-over mode, and they had no fan for us, luckily it was cool enough at night so we have the window opens and have the problem solved. Unfortunately we're on the 1st floor (the floor above main storey), so we're worried about people climbing in, and it gets noisy. - breakfast (scrambled eggs) not hot enough at times - our double bed is weird, not only it's 2 single beds pushed together (which seems like european standard), each bed is made separately - 2 single bed sheet, and 2 separate comforters. - it would be nice to have a full length mirror in the room We're not on the street late enough to comment on whether it's safe at night. We're usually back at the hotel around 8:30pm/9pm, it felt ok. But generally it's not bad walking towards Republicca, but doesn't look very nice going the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chloebebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with a nice size of room, and it was only 3 mins walk from the hotel to Termini (very easy to get around the city night and day). Hotel staffs were very helpful, and their morning breakfast had lots of choices. Internet fees was bit high. Take bus #175 from termini to St. Peters, #40 to Spanish steps and the famous Fontana.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not 4 star - but good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kemish
Reviews.Content: Lovely new hotel, in a central position. Good for exploring the city and local restaurants. We didn't get the bath promised, but did not make a fuss about getting one. Room slightly smaller than we expected. Breakfast good and Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: brijan37
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean. Rooms are quite big, although the TV only had one English station. Located very close by the Termini station, it made travelling alot easier. It was alos close by to some attractions like the colosseo. Breakfast was nice, had quite a variety to choose from. Front desk was good, always greeting and helping when asked on how to reach the different places. Would go back for sure if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience....4 star NOT more like 2 Star !!”
Reviews.Author: Pieronek
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from your site in good faith and believed your site when you said this hotel was a 4 star hotel. It was anything but a average 3 star hotel. We felt cheated when we found out that what we had booked was different to what had been advertised. The room was so tiny you could not open the wardrobe door without hitting the bedside table, TV had only 4 channels that worked, plus the screen was 15 inch which was not clear to watch either. The breakfast was appalling and certainly not 4 star. The building clearly was not a four star hotel and when we checked out they wanted to charge us for the hot water we had requested for making our daughters baby bottles. We were totally disgusted and disappointed with this booking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient for Termini”
Reviews.Author: brgkamp
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights recently, the first night - booked through airmiles - the room was tiny and had a view of the internal courtyard and fire escape, as we'd spent most of the day travelling we put up with it. In it's favour the bed was probably the most comfortable I've slept in. We were moved to a larger room for the remaining 3 nights of our stay, which was OK. The location's good for the station, walking around the main tourist locations and getting an open top bus - which was a very useful way of getting our bearings and getting around. Overall a decent hotel but wouldn't recommend the breakfast, which didn't have a lot of variety and as the hotel didn't seem to have a kitchen was a combination of pre-packaged and brought in sundries.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Columbia_ScMimi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week long visit to Rome. The hotel is conveniently located to Termini station and offers very comfortable lodging. We are a family of four and they offered us their largest room which was quite spacious even with the two extra single beds. One is tucked away in a nook and is a small sofa sleeper and the other bed was a roll away. Our king size bed was wonderful. We enjoyed the firm no-spring mattress. The bathroom was sufficient, though one of the double sink's water pressure was consistently low. The tub in our bathroom was large but had no glass enclosure to prevent water from spraying everywhere so one had to sit and use the hand held shower. The staff is helpful but not overly friendly. Our room was cleaned everyday. The breakfast is good with a variety of items offered. The eggs were a bit watery and at times cold, especially if you got there as soon as breakfast time had begun. Apparently, the buffet burners take time to warm up the eggs which are prepared earlier. Avoid crowds during breakfast time by arriving before 9:00 am. One day we went down for breakfast at 9:00 and were able to find a table but soon the place was overcrowded and there were people waiting for tables. There are many nice restaurants in the area as well as souvenir shops, especially for kids. All in all, it was a good stay and at the end of a very long and tiring day what you really need is a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TowerTwo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 night stay at this hotel which was clean, well decorated and good size room. Reception staff were particularly polite, helpful and spoke good english. The buffet breakfast was excellent and exceeded our expectations with a wide choice including bacon and eggs. The location was very convenient, close to Termini for the metro and airport shuttle, and surrounded by lots of restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great amenities, and an excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: tractorzamboni
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Augusta Lucilla Palace as the last stop on my solo European backpacking trip. I'm glad I forked over some extra cash to stay here instead of the usual backpacker's hostel. Getting to the hotel took a little bit of walking as I had no map and was relying on finding via Massimo d'aglezio. Let me simplify directions, as they are not well described on the hotel website: after taking the express train from Fiumucino Airport to Termini, take the exit onto Piazza Cinquecentro. Walk past the white taxis waiting at the stand, then down the plaza's left side, past the Termini Subway station and the bus stop. After about a minute and a half, toward the end of the plaza you'll see some luggage salesmen and a pharmacy and pizza/gelato store. Look up and you'll see the road going off to the left and a sign above for via d'Aglezio. Turn left here and walk 2 blocks and the hotel is on your left. Once there, I was delighted to be able to check in to my room well ahead of the check-in time--after a sleepless night at London Gatwick, this was a great perk. The room was spacious, impeccably clean, and well appointed. The only English TV channel was CNN international, which was a bit disappointing but I wasn't in Rome for the tv. The bathroom was clean with a warm shower. Comfortable, if firm, bed. The breakfast is included in the stay, and was great--I enjoyed the scrambled eggs, the croissants (though a tad hard compared to those in France!) and some wonderful coffee. After weeks of hostel "breakfast," this was a real treat. The location around the hotel is a tad quiet and somewhat dodgy but it must be said that even the best parts of Rome are somewhat dodgy. However, the convenience to Termini metro station is unmatched--it literally took a minute to walk to the train, both the A and B lines. From there, the Colosseum, Spanish Steps (the most convenient metro stop for the city center attractions like Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc), and Vatican City were just minutes away. After exhausting mornings exploring the ruins or the winding streets and piazzas, you will be very glad that the hotel gave you both a great breakfast and is so close to Termini, you can take a mid-day break, drop off your shopping bags, and regroup for the evening visits. The front desk staff spoke great English and were able to give helpful advice about what to visit in the city. The bar is open til midnight but is not really worth your time--perhaps a quiet nightcap but you're better off having a drink at a cafe before heading back to the hotel. All in all, I could not have asked for a better place to stay (for my modest budget, anyway) to finish my trip through Europe. Clean, quiet, comfortable, and in a wonderfully accessible location--if these are things you value, the Augusta Lucilla Palace should be high on your list of prospective Roman hotels. All that at $85usd a night in March was icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Fordprefect66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights while in Rome. Its a 4 or 5 block walk to the Termini station, so the location was ideal for getting around Rome. It was also a nice 8 or 9 block downhill walk to the Coliseum and Forum area. I was very impressed by the room, comfortable bed, small seating and office area, and approximately 12 foot ceilings. The breakfast was pretty good as long as you stayed away from the hot dishes (watery eggs, undercooked bacon, and cut up hot dogs which I guess were supposed to be sausage). However, there were plenty of continental type options that were great. The staff was very helpful in directing us to the best bus and rail lines to various attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: taido
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Augusta Lucilla Palace for 7 nights starting 11th March. I e-mailed earlier to asko for a spacious room and when we arrived,we were given a very small room. Didn't complain though. Would have needeed a bit more space for clothes etc. Breakfast was ok,nothing fresh and coffee was really weak. Beds were a bit hard too and the heating wasn't working properly or maybe it was switched off,because when we mentioned about it, reception staff put it on again! We liked Rome a lot anyway,very nice cafes with good coffee and sandwiches. Had indian meal twice,rest was italian,fried scamorza cheese with prosciutto was gorgeous, you can have it for example in "tanto amore" -restaurant near the hotel.Went there twice,first time was very good,second night they were busy and it was not so good.mixed with the orders etc.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've used in Rome so far, clean, spacious, friendly staff, will use again. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: beg132
Reviews.Content: Rooms spotlessly clean, great ensuite bathroom, beds very comfortable. Rooms quiet and spaceous. Staff very helfpul and friendly. Central to Termini station and open top bus tours, so easy to get around Rome. Breakfast good - lots of choice and very tasty, though hot food could have been warmer at times. We never went hungry in the morning. No tea/coffee facilities in room and cost around 3euros upwards in hotel. Mini bar prices were cheaper than hotel bar and street vendors. Will definitely use hotel again - highly recommended and will recommend to family and friends. Hotel recommended various restaurants that were excellent though pricey for meals (around 80 euros per couple for one main + ice cream). Suggest local menu tourista that ranges from 8 - 15 euros which were tastier, better value, more courses but had restricted menu. Same for coffees and wine etc. look for prices before you order as we were charged 15 euros for a gin and lemonade, but in a smaller cafe 16 euros for 1lt wine and 2 coffees. It pays to ask before you order. Rome is very costly to eat and drink out at the moment so take your credit card. Watch for bureau de change as commission is high and rates low - we got caught out once.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location but more a 3* hotel than 4*”
Reviews.Author: Pepsika
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 6night stay in this hotel and found the location great it’s just a short walk to the metro and train station. Although we used the metro only one day as the weather was so good we liked to walk and most of the sights are easy to get to by foot. The hotel provided us with a great map with everything clearly marked on it. The train station was very handy when going to and from the airport. We also used it when we travelled to Pompeii for the day. I found the reception/bar staff not the friendliest so we decided not to have many dealings with them. The room was small but adequate for all the length of time you are in your room, there is so much more to see outside. There was a good hairdryer in the room, a small TV with one English channel (CNN) but again your not really there to watch TV. They provide you with 2 x 2in1 bath/shower gel, 2 soaps a shoe shine and a shaving kit. The shower was good, plenty of hot water and fresh towels provided everyday along with the room being given a quick tidy up. Also the room had a good safe which we used and a mini bar which we didn’t use. (Bit pricey) The bed was comfy and the air conditioning good to have but we don’t think ours worked the best. The breakfast was ok. On offer was tea, coffee, bread, bread rolls, cheese ham, eggs, cereal, fruit (not fresh, out of a tin), yogurt, croissants and some sweet rolls and cakes. There was a great restaurant around the corner from the hotel we decided to eat there are last to nights and both times the food was great and not too pricey. We loved the strawberry tiramisu, also great pizza and pastaIt’s called ‘la gallina Bianca’ the street name is ‘via Antonio rosmini’ In all we enjoyed our stay at the Augusta Lucilla Palace but think it’s more of a 3* hotel than a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: Charlois
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in an area very accessable to all the sights of Rome. The Hotel was exceptionally clean, the Reception staff friendly and the Conceirge most helpful. As noted in other reviews of Hotels in Rome, the bedroom was very small. It was not a problem when we made this comment, and were immediately offered a slightly larger room. The Hotel offered a Continental breakfast, and bar/coffee/tea services if required. The room was serviced daily, the bathroom cleaned and fresh linens and towels daily.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 3 starts hotel, not quite perfect for a 4 stars one”
Reviews.Author: SimBucharest
Reviews.Content: I wanted to offer a special gift to my husband for his birthday, so I booked 6 days trip to Rome. After reading all reviews, I decided I'll give it a try. It wasn't bad, actually. The GOOD points: 1. We arrived at 1PM and the check in was immediate, though normally at 2 PM would open. 2. We spoke a bit of italian, but whenever we couldn't find the words, they were able to communicate with us in English quite well. 3. The service was excellent: we were provided with maps and indications, recommendations of nice not very expensive restaurants in the area, over all they were really friendly whatever problem we had. 4. plenty of cookies for breakfast. As I'm pregnant, I found this great! 5. Location was great. REALLY close to the subway. Not more than 3 minutes walking, and pregnant in 6 months... I can't walk to fast :) The ... not so good points: 1.The room was tiny. Basically just a 50 cm band around the bad was all we had. However, I know this is the same in all hotels in Rome, so we couldn't complain. 2.It was increadibly cold in the room when we checked in and we turned on the air conditioning at 30 degrees. It got hot in a few minutes, but then it was impossible to turn it off again, so we ended up sleeping with the window open in order to get some air. 3. Breakfast was ok generally (from 7 to 10), but twice we came at 9h30 and the milk wasn't kept worm anymore, so impossible to prepare a hot chocolate... I tried the pinaple in sirup twice and it tasted really bad... Then the fruit juices were terrible (all they had was chemistry, no actual fruit in there...).

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: firestarlily
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews for this hotel, I'm soooooooooo glad that I booked this place. This was our major splure in Italy and it did not disappoint. My boyfriend (who is a consultant) said that this was the type of hotels he was used to. The bed was awesome - the best bed we stayed in Italy. I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Rome. Pro: 1. Breakfast buffet had plenty of choices and they kept bringing more food out. They had plenty of choices for drinks (a basket filled with tea choices, coffee, milk, juice, and water). They had choices of 5 different breads, 4 types of meat, 2 types of cheese, butter and plenty of pastries to choose from. 2. The hotel is literally 5 minutes from the metro station. 3. Service - My boyfriend had flown directly from work to Italy and we had a bag filled with his wok clothes. When we flew into Rome we went to the hotel and asked them if they would store our luggage for us for about 4 days they didn't have a problem with it at all. We took an overnight train from Venie into Rome and got in around 7:30 am. We were able to check into our hotel without paying an extra fee. I understand that it's the shoulder season and they had enough rooms but some hotels are stickler and won't let you check in until 3:00 pm unless you pay a fee. 4. Our hotel room was warm. It had it's own temperature control box. This is pretty important because when we stayed in hotel rooms in Cinqe Terra and Florence we were quite cold at night because we couldn't figure out how to use the heater. Cons: 1. The window in our room didn't close properly but we were too lazy to move rooms so we didn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would book again!”
Reviews.Author: Lex79
Reviews.Content: My 5th short trip to Rome and wanted to change to a different hotel from ones we had stayed in previously, but keeping the location around Termini / Via Cavour. This area is excellent for transport around the city (bus/metro/train/tourism buses) and usually excellent value. The Colosseum is a 10-15 minute stroll at the end of Via Cavour with the beautiful church of Santa Maria Maggiore en route. I chose the hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and was pleased. We booked directly with the hotel having obtained a cheaper quote directly (240 euro for 2 nights - double room). The booking was made around 6 weeks in advance. As a comparison, lastminute.com offered the same type of room at the time of booking for £360 - almost twice the price! The location was excellent if arriving at Termini station, it is less than 5 minutes walk. The hotel is situated on a quiet(ish) side road and has recently been refurbished. The foyer of the hotel is simple but clean and the front desk well staffed and friendly (for Rome!) There is a breakfast room on the ground floor but no restaurant in the hotel. Personally I found the breakfast to be fine for a continental breakfast with plenty of selection and satisfactory enough to keep me going with a until the next cafe was reached! To be honest, if you want a luxurious breakfast and exquisite cappucino in your hotel rather than experiencing the best Rome has to offer, then this place is probably not for you! The room on the third floor was spacious with a large bathroom and shower cubicle (no bath). Our view looked over the street but was quiet most mornings and evenings. Room was large with a small sofa/table area, large wardrobe, fridge and large double bed. The tv is a small flatscreen but there is far too much to do in Rome to watch tv in the hotel! I thought the price and quality of the room was excellent for a short trip. I find this 'side' of Termini station much more appealling for a short stay and very convenient. There are some great little restaurants and trattoria's a short walk from the hotel as well as all the local buses to take you all over Rome and run until 00:30hrs.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTruth12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the main train station , there are plenty of resturants near the hotel . Our room was small but was clean and modern . Breaky was a bit poor but didn't expect much else in Europe . Loved Rome but found it expensive in tourist areas , best resturants and cafes down the side streets , if we come again will stay in a different area .

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Summer_76
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel very near to Termini station. Room was good for a few nights stay. The bed was very comfortable! Breakfast wasnt great but was enough to keep you going until lunch. Not much in the streets near by, but a quick trip on the metro takes you to most main areas. We found the hotel staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose well”
Reviews.Author: Barrybloke
Reviews.Content: We wanted a comfortable hotel near the Rome Termini station on our way back from a week in the toe of Italy. This was just what we wanted - an excellent quality room, if a touch small. All the previous comments about the good central location are spot on. The breakfast was fine for us - an improvement on the previous week. We thought our price of £107 per night was good value for Rome. The hotel does not have a restaurant; the cafe 50 yards to the west of the hotel was fine. Lorenzo the concierge was splendid in fixing a trip for us and giving directions

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel close to most main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: kippertronic
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is relatively small and situated literally a five minute walk away from the Termini Railway Station. I flew into Ciampino and was able to take a bus direct to the station for 6 euros. The colloseum, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and Roman Forums are all within easy walking distance. The hotel is situated on a quiet road, so there was no trouble with noise. There isn't really much of an atmosphere in this part of Rome however and finding a happening spot to have a drink in the evening involved a journey. Nearby there are couple of good restaurants - I can recommend la Gallina Bianca, which seemed popular with the locals and Cotto Ristorante, which is very trendy with excellent service. The hotel itself I thought was quite pricey - 120 pounds per night for what we got. The room was small, with a monitor-sized flat screen TV. There was a mini-bar. The bathroom was clean and both the room and bathroom were well decorated with everything in good working order. I understand the hotel is in the process of creating roof-top bar, but I don't know when that will be finished. Breakfast was dismal, with terrible coffee, foul tasting orange squash and plastic cheese. There are chipolata sausages, cold scrambled eggs and very fatty bacon if you can stomach it. The service was pretty good and the blokes who work on the front desk were amusingly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McFingers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The rooms were clean and comfortable. This is a nice functional hotel near the central train station. We picked this hotel primarily for it's location which is good for most of the main sights in Rome, approx 10-20 mins walk, otherwise it is easy to hop on the metro for the Vatican and further afield. It is hard to see how it justifies it's 4 star rating as the facilities are basic and breakfast is just ok! But as somewhere to sleep after a hard days sightseeing it very good.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, comfortable, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PeanutMom
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we did extensive research in finding a hotel for our 3-night stay. We chose this hotel because it was new, the rooms were spacious and it was close to Termini. The Augusta Lucilla Palace did not disappoint. Our room was on the corner and quite large - very clean with modern furnishings. The "king-size" bed was a touch short and quite firm, but my 6'4" husband settled for having his feet hang off the end. The individual room air conditioning was EXCELLENT. After two very busy, hot days touring Roma in early September, our room felt great! The bathroom was new, clean, and a good size(especially for Europe). The continental breakfast spread seemed standard for Italy, but with no warm offerings. Service was attentive. Internet access was steep, so we didn't use it. Might have been nice to have, but we were OK without. The TV was small but we never turned it on - too much to see and do outside the room! The tiled hallway was a little noisy, but we only heard a few doors closing in the late evening, not during the night. However, we are sure our neighbors "appreciated" us rolling our bags down the hallway at 6 in the morning when we left. :) Location, location, location! Just two short blocks from the Termini, we LOVED the quick access to the metro, busses and train - all easy to use in Rome. In the late evening, when we returned to our room, we'd open the window for a bit and listen to the music and singing from the trattorias around the corner. Nice touch. We would definitely stay here again if we ever find ourselves on another trip to Rome - maybe my husband's company will find more work for him to do in Italy. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice actually...”
Reviews.Author: Andre3a
Reviews.Content: As said before in other reviews, the location is very good. But I must say that in the Termini area there are hundreds of hotels :) Anyway, the hotel has indeed small rooms, but that doesn't bother at all, because it is recently refurbished and looks great. Hotel staff was, well...there. Not a very exciting breakfast, but enough to start a day and pretty good considering the small prices they practice at ALP. The rooms were quiet and at the fifth floor, you can get a small nice balcony if you're lucky. I recommend ALP.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stephjb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend this summer. Brilliant location for the connecting bus to the Ryanair flights. 5 minute walk. Also easy walking distance to the Colliseum. Hotel has been completely refurbished and all the rooms are very clean and modern. An excellent buffet breakfast in the main dining room. They also have plans to open a hotel bar soon, but not too worry as there are loads of good bars and eateries within a few minutes walk. A really good find. Fantastico!

Reviews.Title: “Roma”
Reviews.Author: KatushkaMoscow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 3 nights. We arrived late at night and the concierge was very nice. The location is great because it was near the Termini train station and near the subway. The hotel was a comfortable and cozy. The rooms were a little bit small but otherwise they included everything necessary in them. ]

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KCHornfan
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just returned from Rome last week and stayed at the ALP. Not terribly impressed, but not completely disappointed. The Good: Location is GREAT. Termini station is just a few blocks away. Subway station entrance is even closer. Even when the subways close, the walk from any/all of the sights is not bad. Our room was relatively clean, and unlike some of the previous posters, it was relatively large. The Bad: Staff was remarkably unfriendly, and not particularly helpful when it came to obtaining information. Some of the staff spoke little to no English, which is fine, but is contrary to what I have read from others. The shower is poorly designed unless you're at least 6'6". One staff member came into our room without knocking in order to address a safe that was not malfunctioning. Turns out he had the wrong floor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sk18
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, a 5 mins walk from the Termini (the central railway station). Its centrally located and the bus stop for the hop-on hop-off tour is just outside the lane. There are lots of nice restaurants and snack bars around the hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were really nice and clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was also good. On the whole and excellent place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pacsm
Reviews.Content: This is a recentm cheap 4 star hotel in a very central place in Rome. If you arrive by plane to Leonardo's Airport, the best way to get to the city is by train (11 EUR). There is a direct train to the very centre of Rome (termini station), and the Hotel is just a 400mts away from there. After a long flight and 1/2hour train trip, you can bet that you'll enjoy get so fast to the hotel. The rooms are ok, somewat small for a 4 star hotel, by european standarts, but is ok. Nice furniture and a modern bathroom (again, so large, but ok for a 3-4 day stay). termini station is also the major terminal for buses that can take you to any part of town, as well as the link station to the 2 metro routes that cross the undergroud of Rome in an "X" shape, so is very easy for you to get arround from the hotel. Some of the destinations you can reach easely just walking, and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. One thing though: the breakfast is tasteless, with few options, bad juice (awfull, in fact), at the level of a 2 star hotel. This is, for me, the major inconvenience of the hotel, that otherwise would be a fine option. Nevertheless, I still think it is a good choice for a 3-4 day stay, if you can live with a bad breakfast during such time.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Accident!”
Reviews.Author: Rich53y
Reviews.Content: We did not actually book the Augusta Lucilla we had booked into the Imperio (via Venere) but on arrival were told that we were being moved to another hotel nearby. The young man behind the desk said that it was "A four star hotel, much better than this one". The ALP was very closeby, in the next block infact and very smart it was too. It had obviously just been completely refurbished and there was still work being done at the front. We were given a double room on the second floor. There are two lifts as well as the stairs. As with many hotel rooms in Rome (as in Paris and London too) it was on the small side - enough room for a double bed, wardrobe, desk, minibar etc. However it was beautifully appointed with fabric covered walls and good quality fittings. The en-suite shower room was excellent too. There was an efficient air conditioning system and double glazed windows to keep out most of the city noise, although this is a fairly quiet street. There is also a flat screen TV; the only English language channel was CNN News if that sort of thing is important to you. Breakfast was included but this was very average. It is becoming a worrying trend that many hotels in Europe seem to have settled for the same bland breakfast fare. Reconstituted fruit juices, tasteless coffee, processed cheese slices, tinned fruit segments and "draught" yoghurt. There was however plenty of cereal, bread, croissants, cakes and cold meats to compensate. The breakfast was no better, but no worse that in those hotels in wich we have stayed over the past two or three years. Shame really! The hotel staff are very helpful and all speak good English. The ALP is in an excellent location, close to the Stazione Termini (10 mins walk) and close to Metro/bus/tram routes that will take you all over the city and beyond. The area has many bars and restaurants all offering good food. Some are better value than others. When in Rome NEVER order without looking at a menu or price list. If you do sit down and then decide it's too expensive just get up and leave - it's the done thing! Generally speaking the establishments next to the major sites are the dearest so go up a side street or two to find cheaper (and usually better) fare. All in all a nice hotel offering decent value for money in a rapidly improving area of Rome. Recommended.
